column5: Something that rarely gets got on tape

Great video !!  Catching muskies on an 8 is without doubt the most exciting way to get them.  Nothing better than seeing a big girl twisting & turning trying to grab your bait and then just hammering it and the fight is on.  If your not doing an 8 or at least a circle after EVERY cast you missing alot of fish.
Check out the end of this video for another great figure-8 take, on the fly no less.
Awesome, I've tried, but never caught one on the figure 8.   I do it every cast though!

The best way to learn how to do an good 8 is to LOTW. On waters where they seem to only eat on the 8' you learn really quickly how to do it right.  Musky on the fly is something I really want to start doing. Those ones look like they came from St Clair.
1/3 of my St Clair muskies came on figure eights last summer. It is a great feeling. And there is a knack to it. That guy's figure eights looked a little sketchy but it worked.

Insane stuff. I can't imagine a good size Musky on a fly rod. I finally had the pleasure of feeling the power of a few smaller Musky on heavy equipment last fall with Dan Columby, all I can describe it as is pure power, unadulterated power. The closest had to be a 33lb King in Lake Ontario.
Awesome,hope to get some this summer like that!

The best way to learn how to do an good 8 is to LOTW. On waters where they seem to only eat on the 8' you learn really quickly how to do it right.  You certainly don't need to travel to LOTW to learn how to get fish on a figure 8. All muskies will hit an 8 and ANY lake that has muskies is a good spot for a newbie to learn how to do it.
It'd be a nice trip for sure.

You certainly don't need to travel to LOTW to learn how to get fish on a figure 8. All muskies will hit an 8 and ANY lake that has muskies is a good spot for a newbie to learn how to do it.  I was a bit sloppy with my post. I meant to say fish waters where you see a lot of fish follow and eat on the 8. You really learn to refine your technique.
